query_summary: A typo in the inner conditional uses P[i] >= P[i] and (F[i] - F[j]) instead of P[i] >= P[j] and (F[j] - F[i]), so the dominance check compares an element with itself and reverses the feature-difference direction.
oracle_summary: A typo in the inner conditional uses P[i] >= P[i] and (F[i] - F[j]) instead of P[i] >= P[j] and (F[j] - F[i]), so the dominance check compares an element with itself and reverses the feature-difference direction.

retrieved.summary: The buggy code incorrectly calculates the expected value of `B[i][j]` by using an incorrect formula, leading to potential false negatives when checking if the matrix satisfies a specific pattern.
retrieved.diff:
--- 
+++ 
@@ -8,7 +8,7 @@
 i0 = (B[0][0])//7
 for i in range(N):
     for j in range(M):
-        if B[i][j] != (i+i0)*7 + j + j0 +1 or B[i][j] > lim:
+        if B[i][j] != B[0][0] + i*7 + j or B[i][j] > lim:
             flag = False
 if flag:
     print("Yes")

retrieved.summary: The buggy code incorrectly iterates only through the first N-1 elements of the sorted union of sets A and B, potentially missing valid pairs that span both sets when the total number of elements is N + M.
retrieved.diff:
--- 
+++ 
@@ -2,7 +2,7 @@
 A = set(map(int, input().split()))
 B = set(map(int, input().split()))
 C = sorted(list(A | B))
-for i in range(N - 1):
+for i in range(N + M - 1):
   if C[i] in A and C[i + 1] in A:
     print('Yes')
     exit()
